docs.snippet: Grass-roots democracy still has a hard time flourishing in South America, but the outlook is hopeful, a group of United States business, labor and civic leaders reported yesterday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Grass-roots democracy still has a hard time flourishing in South America, but the outlook is hopeful, a group of United States business, labor and civic leaders reported yesterday.
docs.abstract: group members amplify findings; note hard struggle for democracy

headline.main: 30 FROM U. S. LOOK AT LATIN AMERICA; Leaders in Various Fields Find Grass-Roots Activity Having Hard Struggle

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: AMERICAN NATIONS AND WESTERN HEMISPHERE POSSESSIONS

docs.snippet: Foreign exchange market was dull during the past week. British pound sterling and Canadian dollar moved narrowly on moderate dealings.
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchange market was dull during the past week. British pound sterling and Canadian dollar moved narrowly on moderate dealings.

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 9 -- The United States, Britain, Australia and other countries decided today to propose the appointment of a United Nations "agent" on the Hungarian question.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Dec. 9 -- The United States, Britain, Australia and other countries decided today to propose the appointment of a United Nations "agent" on the Hungarian question.
docs.abstract: 30 nations including US, GB and Australia draft resolution proposing UN appt 'agent' to rept on Hungary's compliance with UN resolutions; US reptdly abandons idea of asking suspension of Hungarian delegation's credentials

headline.main: U.N. 'AGENT' URGED IN HUNGARY CASE; 30-Nation Plan Aims at New Move to Obtain Compliance With Assembly Actions

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) -- The United States threw its support today behind proposals to create common markets in Latin America to encourage production.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 9 (UPI) -- The United States threw its support today behind proposals to create common markets in Latin America to encourage production.

headline.main: LATIN FREE TRADE ENDORSED BY U. S.; Washington Pledges Its Aid to Establishment of New Common Market Areas
